intro: Trichocline macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed trichocline, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its showy yellow flowers are followed by spherical, dry seed heads that aid in wind dispersal. Trichocline macrocephala is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
